page.title: 01Introduction
page.content:
The area lies on the estuary of the River Exe to the south of the City of Exeter. Approximately half of the land is gently rolling farmland. The estuary of the river and its associated flat, flood plain land accounts for much of the rest. The main settlements are the village of Exminster and a residential area known as Countess Wear which is a suburb of Exeter. Through traffic is mainly diverted to the south of the city and trunk roads including the M5 motorway are the main feature of this area.
Additional features include a canal, sewage works, Exminster Hospital, part of Exeter golf course, playing fields, caravan site and Naval Supply Depot.
